item.title: Morning Walk with Chains
item.description: Returned to Raten today for a shorter walk just wearing chains instead of snowshoes: 3.15km, 96m ascent, 0h:47m, 8°C ☀️. Bus service comes every 30 minutes, so I wanted to keep the walk to under an hour. The return bus conveniently drops me off in front of a coffeeshop and the grocery store, so I was able to fuel up with coffee and do some pre-Thanksgiving grocery shopping.

item.title: First Snowshoe Hike of the Season
item.description:
The snowfall was two days ago and it was quite warm today, but the snow was still in decent condition and the terrain pretty.

Raten to Bellevue (and back): 4.97 km, 144 m ascent, 1h:22m, 7°C ⛅️

... and there was actually a view from Bellevue today (towards Lake Zürich).

item.title: Morning Walk with Snow
item.description: We had a relatively big snowfall last night. I wanted to go showshoe up at Raten Pass, but the bus service up there was canceled due to heavy snowfall. I settled for walking the usual farm fields in the valley instead. Maybe tomorrow I can showshoe.

item.title: Morning Walk
item.description: Lovely crisp -3°C morning in the Ägeri valley. More snow arrives this afternoon.

item.title: Testing Mastodon Author Tags
item.description:
... by writing a short post about testing Mastodon author tags. It's all very meta. Quite literally because you add a meta tag with the fediverse:creator property to your HTML document's head.

(Hat tip to David Chartier for pointing me to Robb Knight's instructions.)

item.title: First Snow of Fall
item.description: I was only expecting rain this morning, not a wintry mix that turned into light snow. Tomorrow afternoon we have a level 3 (of 5) heavy snowfall warning. I need to get the winter tires put on the car.

item.title: It's Grittibänz Season Already
item.description:
I was feeling a bit down this afternoon, so I decided to walk out to a local cafe for a cup of coffee and maybe a sweet treat. To my surprise it's already Grittibänz season. Grittibänz are bread men made from sweet dough. They are traditional in December around Saint Nicholas Day (Recipe).

It seems like the internet (and perhaps real life) is full of bad stuff lately. Be kind to yourself and don't forget to give yourself a little treat every now and then.

item.title: It's Perfect Weather
item.description:
... for working out on the terrace (that's my paddling gear drying to the side).

I rarely do this because I like my 32" monitor, extended keyboard, and mouse, but every now and then it's good to mix things up. As soon as the sun reaches me though I'm back indoors.

item.title: Just a Little Bit of Mist
item.description: ... over Lake Ägeri this morning. The mist forms occasionally when the water is warmer than the air (a necessary but not sufficient condition). Today was my third day in a row of waking up early and getting a quick 30-minute paddle in before work, but it was the first day with some evaporation fog despite the other two days being colder.

item.title: Fresh Eggs
item.description: Living outside of the big city in Switzerland means living near farms, mostly small ones. I live near three small farms. They all sell their products in small honor system stores. For the farm next door I pick up eggs directly from the coop. They're actually cheaper than grocery store eggs, and I know the chickens are treated well because I can see them pecking in their yard from our apartment. Anyway I picked up fresh eggs on Saturday and was just reflecting on how different this is for me than life in the suburbs in the United States.
